intro: Taonabo coriacea, commonly known as the rough-skinned balm, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features rough, hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, and it produces small, hard seeds. Taonabo coriacea is often found in arid or semi-arid environments, where it demonstrates resilience to drought conditions.
